{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3755918,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2025-10-05T19:57:56.694Z","cooked":"

I’ve started to switch over to Milwaukee M12 stuff after at least a decade of old-school 12v NiCd Makita pods. I’ve built a LOT of special things that fit the Makita batteries. One of them is a nice buck-boost with all kinds of settings. Super useful, especially knowing it is 100% floating and super controllable.
Here it is testing a {redacted} on my kitchen island

image164×195 66.6 KB

The new version starts with mangling one of these guys (look for cheap on Fleabay). Trim the flange around the connector hole to go in the slot of the case, and clean off all the bumps on the back of the housing so it goes in flush. Trim off all the protruding wires on the PCB. Replace the black and red wires with longer ones to reach the power supply.
Note that the battery socket is at an 11 degree angle. The housing is designed to match that!

image181×232 72.3 KB

All you want is the connector housing and the blade PCB. The black and red wires are the only ones you need. There’s a little 4-40 screw through the PCB.

image332×267 38.7 KB

The bananna plugs are fiddly; use a nut driver.
The Andersons have a shoulder; they go in from the outside. Superglue…
Here it is in use. Its sized so the small battery is flush with the bottom when installed. The big batteries will stick out and provide a solid footing instead of the housing feet.
Critical: make sure you program the undervoltage lockout to 10.5 Volts. This function is NOT built into the battery!!!

image270×239 34.5 KB

milwaukee_power_back.zip (31.8 KB)

Sorry, forgot the power supply link!

amazon.com

Amazon.com: DROK Adjustable Voltage Regulator - Color LCD Display Buck Boost...

DROK Buck Boost Converter 36V 5A 90W Parameter Input Voltage: DC 6.0-36V Output Voltage: DC 0.5-36V Output Current: 0-5A Output Power: 90W Voltage Resolution: 0.01V Current Resolution: 0.001A Voltage Accuracy: ±0.3% + 3 words (Calibratable) Current...

$21.99

It has a fun scrolling graph page too! Controls for voltage, current, power, etc.

Note that you can set it up so that you can CHOOSE the start up state. I suggest “off”
